revised_title: The Influence of Drugs on Electrical Conductivity of the Palm of the Hand
tldr: This study investigates the effects of various drugs, including alcohol, chloroform, morphia, atropine, and pilocarpine, on the electrical conductivity of the palm of the hand. The results show that while some drugs have a significant impact on conductivity, others, such as atropine, have no observable effect. The research also highlights the distinction between emotive changes caused by drugs and those resulting from other factors like pain or fear of injections.
